intro: Helothrix pusilla, commonly known as the small helothrix, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Helothrix pusilla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
